item.title: Stupid Errors
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

well this is the fixed code :

else if (useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 3994) { copper2(); } else if (useItemID == 438 && atObjectID == 3994) { tin2(); } else if (useItemID == 440 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 19) { sendMessage("You need 20 smithing!"); } else { iron2(); } } else if (useItemID == 453 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 34) { sendMessage("You need 35 smithing!"); } else { coal2(); } } else if (useItemID == 447 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 44) { sendMessage("You need 45 smithing!"); } else { mith2(); } } else if (useItemID == 449 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 59) { sendMessage("You need 60 smithing!"); } else { addy2(); } } else if (useItemID == 451 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 89) { sendMessage("You need 90 smithing!"); } else { rune2(); } }

fuck knows why you think you need 2 brackets in the first 2 calls…

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Errors
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

That won’t work LeScape. You need the two brackets at the end of the code so that it doesn’t roll right into the next code.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Errors
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

                                                    else if (useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 3994) {
				copper2();
				}
				else if (useItemID == 438 && atObjectID == 3994) {
				tin2();
				}
				else if (useItemID == 440 && atObjectID == 3994 && playerLevel[13] <= 19) {
				sendMessage("You need 20 smithing!");
				} else if (playerLevel[13] >= 20) {
	                                       iron2();
				}
				else if (useItemID == 453 && atObjectID == 3994 && playerLevel[13] <= 34) {
				sendMessage("You need 35 smithing!");
				} else if (playerLevel[13] <= 35) {
					coal2();
				} else if (useItemID == 447 && atObjectID == 3994 && playerLevel[13] <= 44) {
				sendMessage("You need 45 smithing!");
				} else if (playerLevel[13] >= 45) {
					mith2();
				} else if (useItemID == 449 && atObjectID == 3994 && playerLevel[13] <= 59) {
				sendMessage("You need 60 smithing!");
				} else if (playerLevel[13] >= 60) {
					addy2();
				} else if (useItemID == 451 && atObjectID == 3994 && playerLevel[13] <= 89) {
				sendMessage("You need 90 smithing!");
				} else if (playerLevel[13] >= 90) {
					rune2();
				}

Change it to that

item.title: Stupid Errors
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

That may be right, but do you have the voids for the TEXT();'s?
Example:

public void NAME OF VOID(){
	if (actionTimer == 0)
	{
		addItem(ITEM ID TO ADD,ITEM AMOUNT);
		sendMessage("TEXT.");
		deleteItem(ITEM ID TO DELETE,getItemSlot(ITEM ID TO DELETE),ITEM AMOUNT TO DELETE);
		addSkillXP((EXP ADDED*playerLevel[LEVEL ID]), LEVEL ID);
        actionName = "NAME TO BE CALLED UPON IN USEITEM";
		actionTimer = TIME - 10 = 1 second;
		startAnimation(EMOTE ID);
		updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
	}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Errors
item.dc:creator: @Randomhero Randomhero
item.description:
@Randomhero wrote:

I think I may have found it. Correct me if I’m wrong, but under where it says

else if (useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 3994)
				{
					copper2();
				}
				}
				else if (useItemID == 438 && atObjectID == 3994)
				{
					tin2();
				}
				}

I don’t think you need 2 brackets. Try this:

Highlight, right-click, and Copy this code:

[code]else if (useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 3994)
{
copper2();
}

			else if (useItemID == 438 && atObjectID == 3994)
			{
				tin2();
			}[/code]

Now highlight everything in that code down to

tin2(); } }

And paste my code. Tell me if it works or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Errors
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Ok, I was adding some useItemID atObjectID codes, and they look just fine to me, yet when I compile, I get 100 errors. I have looked through the code a lot and found nothing wrong with it.

else if (useItemID == 436 && atObjectID == 3994) { copper2(); } } else if (useItemID == 438 && atObjectID == 3994) { tin2(); } } else if (useItemID == 440 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 19) { sendMessage("You need 20 smithing!"); } else { iron2(); } } else if (useItemID == 453 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 34) { sendMessage("You need 35 smithing!"); } else { coal2(); } } else if (useItemID == 447 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 44) { sendMessage("You need 45 smithing!"); } else { mith2(); } } else if (useItemID == 449 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 59) { sendMessage("You need 60 smithing!"); } else { addy2(); } } else if (useItemID == 451 && atObjectID == 3994) { if(playerLevel[13] <= 89) { sendMessage("You need 90 smithing!"); } else { rune2(); } }
So, anyone see anything wrong?
I hate these errors that I can’t figure out >.<

Read full topic
